title: Portsmouth to hold takeover talks with ex-Disney CEO
text:
Read more about sharing. Michael Eisner was chief executive of Walt Disney until 2005 Portsmouth are to enter into exclusive discussions with former Walt Disney chief executive Michael Eisner about a potential takeover of the club. 
Reports of Eisner, 75, and his Tornante Investment Group's interest in the League Two club emerged on Monday. 
A 70-day period of negotiation and due diligence has begun. 
Portsmouth have been a fan-owned club since exiting administration in 2013, with the Supporters' Trust (PST) owning a minority stake of 48%. 
Eisner, who is also a former President of Paramount Pictures, posted on Twitter: "Exciting times! Looking forward to coming over and meeting you all. Good luck against Newport County on Saturday!!" 
During negotiations, Eisner is expected to explain his future strategy and plans for the club to all shareholders. 
Portsmouth will not engage in discussions with any other potential bidder during the 70-day period. 
Its board have retained Trevor Birch to advise them during the negotiating process, who will liaise with all of the club's stakeholders. 
Birch, a former administrator, was heavily involved in negotiations during the PST's acquisition of the club in 2013. 
If a proposed deal is negotiated successfully, shareholders will vote on whether to accept it. 
More to follow.
